reviews.text:
Everything about our visit was incredible! the food, the atmosphere, and especially the service. The seafood was so fresh, perfectly cooked, and bursting with flavor. The Cajun spice was so good- just the right kick and packed with rich, mouthwatering taste!

Our waitress Bell was phenomenal. She was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had the best experience possible. She really went above and beyond to make our night really fun!

A huge shoutout as well to Sean and Tum, who were both so welcoming and added to the amazing vibe of the evening.

If youâ€™re looking for fresh seafood, amazing flavors, and top-notch service, Aqua Boil NYC is definitely the place to go. Highly recommended! ğŸ¦ğŸ”¥ğŸ’™

The food was absolutely amazing and the portion was undeniably large. Bell was amazing from start to finish. She was always attentive and very nice. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys seafood and margaritas.
Everything we had was delicious and fresh!

Aqua boil is always so delicious!!!!!!!  I get the shrimp Cajun mix spicy with an extra sweet strawberry margarita!  Chefâ€™s kiss!! Iâ€™ve been coming here for years and this restaurant never disappoints! Great customer service and food! The staff is always so friendly and patient. Bell, Tanya and Perry are the best!!!!! â¤ï¸
The food and the service is amazing, staff is so helpful ğŸ˜‡
Awesome, superfriendly and attentive

Absolutely amazing experience at Aqua Boil!

Cherbel and Tanya made our night unforgettable â€” their energy, kindness, and attention to detail were on another level. You can tell they genuinely care about every guest and love what they do. The food was incredible (the seafood boil was fresh and full of flavor!), but honestly, itâ€™s the vibe they create that makes this place special.

They treated us like family, checked in often, and made sure everything was perfect from start to finish. You can feel the good energy as soon as you walk in â€” great music, great food, great people.

Highly recommend coming here and asking for Cherbel and Tanya â€” theyâ€™ll make sure you have the best time!
Super good,clean and good service

[A restaurant that discriminates against people based on race]

The food was average, but the tables were too close together, making it uncomfortable to move around.
The staff kept checking on other tables and refilling their water, but no one came to ours except when we placed the order.
They didnâ€™t clear the shells or empty plates, so our trash bin was overflowing and it was really inconvenient.
We had to call several times before a short-haired male staff member finally came.
I believe this experience was discriminatory, and it made us feel very unwelcome.

ì¸ì¢… ì°¨ë³„ ì‹ë‹¹ ì ˆëŒ€ ê°€ê³ ì‹¶ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ
Food is Delicious ğŸ˜‹ ğŸ˜ drinks are ğŸ”¥
Every time I come to NYC I have to go Aqua Boil they have the best Seafood Boils I have ever had
It was probably not the best time to go, it was late and busy but it was very good!

We were a bit late for our reservation (about 15 minutes) but thankfully there was still space!

We were looking around to see what the table beside us ordered and we saw the Mad Ocean combo!

We went with 2 lbs of shrimp, 1 lb of snow crab legs (they only limit you to a pound since it's quite expensive) and 2 lbs of crayfish, mild for spiciness but I truly think medium is better, get some extra sauce on the side for $4 (highly recommend it!)

At first, we thought the food wasn't enough, so we ordered soft shelled crab which came with a side of Cajun fries! It was more than enough actually! The soft shelled crab is amazing too but the mad ocean combo was insanely nice!

The service was nice! I didn't get your name (one of the employees wearing a black cap) you were very nice and we found it great!
I loved the seafood combo with the cajun sauce at medium spice level. Seafood tasted fresh and service was great. It wasnâ€™t too crowded either and the restaurant had a nice cozy setup.

We walked in looking for a light dinner and we walked away more than satisfied. We had the Lobster Roll and jambalaya, and both were delicious. My only regret after ordering was seeing the mouth watering boils coming out to others. Weâ€™ll definitely be back with a bigger appetite soon!
Reliable. The food was very good & creative, using unique items. You'll appreciate the value matched with quality. Workers showed kind attention. I'll make this a regular spot.
Omg! Just amazing! Do check them out. I loved their boil with cajun mix spice. I also tried mac and cheese and lobster, but if I have to choose one, ill definitely go with the boil.

Their dishes show attention to details that matter. I've experienced various menu items with decent results. This place serves distinctive food and I'm grateful it's available. The personnel combine sincere friendliness with vigilant service. The staff is professional, the restaurant stays spotless and I want to visit again.

Amazing, friendly staff.
Clean and modern locale.
Great seafood boil.

Highly recommend.
After dining here, the next day my husband and I woke up feeling very sick. We had to spend the entire day in bed with nausea, chills, and fever. The only item we both ate were the prawns

I went for the seafood boil but the shrimp, calamari, and catfish basket caught my eye. I've never had catfish before so it was the perfect time to try it.

The flavors were good overall. Catfish was very soft and had great flavor. Loved the calamari and shrimp but I just wish there was more seafood. The plate went heavy on the fried and very light on the protein.

To share, we ordered the corn ribs and as tasty as they were, they was too overpriced for what they were.

If I go back, I will follow my gut and get the seafood boil.
æœåŠ¡å’Œæ°›å›´æŒºå¥½çš„ï¼Œæµ·é²œä¹Ÿå°±ä¸€èˆ¬å§ï¼Œé…±æ±å¯ä»¥ï¼Œæµ·é²œæ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆå‘³é“ï¼Œçº¯åƒé…±ï¼Œä¸ç®—éš¾åƒ
GÃ¼zel bir deneyimdi. Ã‡evredeki iyi restoranlardan biri. Kajun sosu damak tadÄ±mÄ±za uygun. Malzemesi bol. Temiz. FiyatÄ± ucuz sayÄ±lmaz.
Hell yeah, it's located in Hell's Kitchen where there are a plethora of nice restaurants. This seafood restaurant had good food, excellent customer service and was immaculent.  :0)
My friend brought me there for my birthday about 4 mths back n i really enjoyed. The service was a 10.
Great food, great staff all around 10/10 !!!

Food is good, seafood is fresh with no issues in quality. The bill automatically includes a service charge. On the plus side, you donâ€™t have to calculate the tip yourself, and it ensures the staff gets paid fairly. That part makes sense, but if itâ€™s your first time and you donâ€™t notice, it can feel a bit sudden and confusing, like you might need to add another tip on top. It would be better if the menu or bill showed this more clearly to avoid any misunderstanding.
If you close at 10 â€¦. Only to go orders before 9:30 is outrageous.  Just wanted to pop in for a quick dinner as a single dinerâ€¦. also who wants to eat a crab boil to freaking go?!
Fresh corn and crab! Refreshing lemonade and crispy fries. I had seafood boil and my friend got their calamari. Itâ€™s my first time having such food and I was not disappointed. Iâ€™d return.
Incredible food and service, and really unique experience!
The food here is worth the money. Expensive depending on what you get. I recommend Lobster mac and cheese very tasty and good pieces of lobster.
The seafood boil is flavorful and reasonably priced for NY. Try the Cajun and mala seasonings!

We ordered a whole lobster which was plonked on the table in a plastic bag with sauce and 2 halves potato inside the bag. The lobster was Not fresh and it was chewy. We also ordered the Shrimps in cajun sauce which was tasty but again the shrimps were served in a plastic bag.
The staff is very nice but the food was disappointing the cajun sauce which supposed to be the most popular was very bad no taste at all i am really disappointed

I ordered 1 pound of snow crab boil, paid $41 and only got 2 clusters of crab which is 1/2 pound not 1 pound. Big rip off! I will gp back to HCrab in Queens where you get exactly what i paid for and boils are way better quality
The whole experience was great.
This is exactly what I wanted.
Everything was so good!!! 100% recommend!!!
Simply perfect I loved everything, the waitress is super nice  and the food is wonderful, I will return without a doubt :p

Il boil viene servito in un sacchetto di plastica e questa Ã¨ una pecca ma l'attenzione mostrata nel servizio Ã¨ notevole.
Per chi preferisce mangiare pesce e crostacei questo Ã¨ un posto da provare.
Molto consigliato.

We wanted to experience US style seafood boil and found this place very close to our hotel. It turned out the owner of the shop came from the same hometown then it just felt like home. They were a little bit under staff at the time so we needed to wait a little bit longer than we thought but definitely worth the time.

We ordered shrimp and snow crab boil with Cajun sauce and added clams separately. Snow crab is the MVP. So sweet and so moist. Super fresh. The cajun sauce was also tasty, a little spicy and creamy. They offered a lot of sauce. If youâ€™re Thai or familiar with Thai food, you can ask for the Thai style spicy seafood sauce as well. Their corn rib also super goood. Went so well with the ranch so donâ€™t miss it.
Delicious best crab boil ive had in a long time! Needs a little more sauce in the bag because it was so good. Q

Amazing seafood boil right in the heart of Manhattan. Started with the fried calamari/shrimp, fillet, fries basket that was great and the 1lb shrimp and snow crab combo that was heavenly. The flavor and seasoning of the boil was fantastic, not too runny or thick. Service was friendly and on point. Would most definitely go back.

This was our first time at this restaurant. My daughter loves crab books and we are visiting from out of state. The food itself was really great, it had good flavor and spice... however we got shrimp head off and ate almost all of the shrimp when I realized that they had not been deveined. It's not a horrible thing but it is disgusting! That is the shrimps poop and to be honest no one really wants to eat that. That's really the only reason for the 3 stars. Just making people aware and maybe to let the cooks know that that is supposed to be done before cooking and serving.

Great unpretentious spot for good quality seafood. Best to make a reservation for parties larger than two. Plan to go with people you enjoy sharing with. Portions are generous and very tasty but a little messy. Missed having a little cocktail sauce.
One of my favourite restaurants in ny every time Iâ€™m here Iâ€™m coming to this place . Amazing and high quality sea food . Cooked so well
ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Atmosphere was nice, super casual and messy! Full was nice, takes time sou est because of the process but it is really enjoyable! We got 2 lobster rolls, fried calamari and the combo, it was enough for four. You should try this!
Idk what was in the sauce today but holy damn 10/10 I love the chef

The high rating is misleading, there are much better places same concept in manhattan with similar rating, and the waiter told me to get another beer because it the happy hour to find later that the beer is $9 instead $10 regular price!!

A great seafood spot!
We really enjoyed the delicious soup and flavorful sauces. The calamari was especially impressiveâ€”soft, fresh, and perfectly cooked. The staff was very friendly and attentive, offering helpful recommendations that made the meal even better. Highly recommend!

Been here 2x service is always good. The cajun mix is my go to flavor. I ordered the mad ocean wish there was more sauce but still tasty. Ambience is lively and has good music. Would recommend if youâ€™re in the area.

Excellent good with good prices. The shrimp (4/5) and the crab (5/5) is succulent and flavorful. For $40 you can easily feed 2 people. They also have great Cajun fries (3.5/5). Service is fast but make sure to reserve cause this place packs up.

Muy divertida la experiencia de almorzar aquÃ­. Hay que hacer reserva.
HabÃ­a poca gente. El lugar se ve sencillo, pero la experiencia de comer es lo mejor: usas delantal y guantes para comer.
La comida con un sabor muy bueno.
No es un lugar econÃ³mico, pero la experiencia hace que valga la pena.

These people really take care of your visit starting from seating you, feeding you, and then taking payment.  Itâ€™s small but the service is fast and friendly. They checked on us three times. Our catfish was soooo delicious, lightly breaded, and non greasy. I donâ€™t usually eat fries that come with the food but they are tasty, soft and not greasy.

The restaurant is a little smaller than expected, but the decor & service was great. The servers were very polite and the food comes out quick. However, the food was not seasoned well. I ordered the crab legs with mild garlic butter sauce. & I can only taste butter. It was very disappointing. As an appetizer I ordered the garlic honey wings which were good. The food is expensive as well. Typically sides are included in the boils. Overall Iâ€™d give the place a 3/5.

My first seafood boil experience and I was not disappointed!!! I ordered the Cajun fries and a boil with snow crab, shrimp and corn, garlic butter, medium spice and it was DELICIOUS!!! Also had their peach margarita and they weren't shy on their pours. While it seemed that the servers were maybe a bit overwhelmed, if you flag them down they help you immediately. It's a messy, fun way to enjoy fresh seafood - I do recommend making a reservation though because it was a busy place!

Good lobster roll. It was large and juicy on a perfect bun. Came with cajun fries which were nicely seasoned. Seafood boil was very popular - nearly everyone around us ordered it!

About a 5 minute wait on a Monday night at 7pm. They really know how to pack people in!

Tasty snow crab and shrimp, got the $58 deal 1 lb snow crab and 1lb shrimp with head, it's cheaper than order it seperately. Great music with relaxing vibe. Go when you have at least an hour to take time to enjoy the meal.

Das hier sei vorausgesetzt: Ich esse kein Fisch, nur Garnelen. Aber auch hier war die Versuchung zu groÃŸ, als dass ich mir das durch die Lappen gehen lasse.

Serviert wird in einem tollen Ambiente diese TÃ¼te, die man sich zusammenstellen kann. Ich habe noch nie solche groÃŸen Garnelen gesehen! Lecker. Gute Marinade. Mit den Lobsters werde ich nicht warm, ist Geschmackssache!

Man bekommt eine Schere und einen â€Knackerâ€œ, um den Panzer bzw. die Schale zu knacken. Einen Eimer, um den Abfall reinzuwerfen.

Service aufmerksam, schnell und freundlich. Aber der Preis knallt halt: FÃ¼r zwei Personen werdet ihr 100 Dollar los. Muss man sich Ã¼berlegen und auch nur hin, wenn man diese Art von Fishfood mag.

Aqua Bowl is a fantastic spot for Cajun seafood boil and perfect for groups and families. Our party of six adults, two toddlers, and a baby felt right at home, thanks to their super friendly staff.

They serve various appetizers and seafood options with ingredients delivered daily and fresh. The portion was generous and more than enough for six adults at a reasonable price. The seafood combo was fresh and flavorful, and the lobster roll was absolutely amazing.

Highly recommend for a delicious and welcoming dining experience!

Compared to the other seafood boil place down the street, I personally like the sauce (Cajun) here more, but one lb per person isnâ€™t really enough to be filling. I went once last summer and again recently. The clams now have massive shells that prob take up most of the weight and they donâ€™t give corn as a basic set anymore.

We were recommended to. Is it this casual eatery. They offer seafood, lobster, snow crab, clams, muscles, and shrimps cook in different sauces or Cajun, butter lemon etc. we had shrimp and snow crab in mild Cajun sauce. Clams in lemon butter. Muscles in black pepper. Also Shrimp gumbo, broccoli, and Brussels sprouts as for side dishes. The seafood was quite fresh apart from 2-3 shrimp that were a bit doubtful. The clams taste good but they were too high, hence very chewy. The muscles were so size fresh and juicy. The gumbo and all the side dishes were very good. Our server was pleasant and he ran around the room efficiently to serve everyone. Itâ€™s one of those place that you eat seafood like you eat at home..using both hands!

Craving for some Cajun seafood boil? Gather up everyone and make your way to Aqua Boil in Hellâ€™s Kitchen for a feast! Grab a seat, sit down, and order some fresh seafood with their friendly staffs. Put that bib on and slide some gloves because itâ€™s about to get messy! Thereâ€™s many sauces to choose from and if youâ€™re all about that spiciness, mala sauce is something you gotta try. A beer or cocktail from the Aqua Bar definitely goes well with Aqua Boilâ€™s food. Amazing food, stupendous flavor, outstanding service, and great environment is what you can expect here. Come early and enjoy some $9 happy hour specials until 6pm everyday.

The food is good. I found this place on nycfoodspots on Insta. We were sat near the door which was cold and our food got cold pretty quickly. But you do get your money's worth. My family got there 1/2 hour after opening and the place filled up fast. We were asked if we had reservations, so you may want to call ahead.
You wonâ€™t find better gumbo east of New Orleans than Aqua Boil. Everyone else loved their seafood but I stayed focus on the liquid gold.

I eat boils almost once every two weeks, so Iâ€™d consider myself knowledge enough in this area. This place was great, but not amazing. I felt like the sauce was lacking that powerful punch of flavor you expect from a boil, also not enough sauce in the bag either. But, I appreciate how the shrimp heads were prepared, how the fries were done really well, and the seafood was good quality. The service was fairly attentive and nice. Only thing I would change is the way they tell you sit on the bench until your whole party is there, I typically see this in upscale restaurants with bigger parties and tougher reservations, not in a place that wasnâ€™t packed where youâ€™d be putting gloves and a bib on to chomp down on some shrimp. Also, they need to work on their sauce game considering thatâ€™s one of the essentials of a great boil.

Came on a Friday night and didn't need to make reservations or anything. Was able to be seated after 10min. I was interested in trying their lobster roll which was really good. Much better than their lobster mac and cheese. The honey garlic wings were really good too.
First and foremost tom was a great server and the food was amazing at aqua I canâ€™t wait to come here with more of my family and friendsâ€¦
